result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 11:45 am.

10:09 AM Cases 22CF126, 2022CF000154, 2022CF000170, and 2022CF000194 called together.  Defendant Jacob T Hughes-Lepinski in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Jacob T Hughes-Lepinski.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 22CF154, 22CF170, and 22CF194 on for arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of informations, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Pollak notes def has signed his updated bond and contact information.  Requesting to extend deadline for motions to the next status conference; Court grants.  Atty Pollak recites offer- pleas to 3 misdemeanors- theft, DC, and amended Ct 1 of 22CF170; DRI all others, 2 yrs probation, withheld sentence.  Have not yet discussed expungement.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 11:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob T Hughes-Lepinski

Prior: 3480 - 115th Street, Frederic, WI 54837
Amended/corrected bond form returned undeliverable
Bond Modification Class Completed by Defendant

$250 cash bond to cover Burnett County cases 22CF194, 22CF170, 22CF154, and 22CF126.  No violent or abusive contact with the victim or the victim's residence. No driving without a valid driver's license. No driving any vehicles without the owner's permission.  The defendant is subject to a curfew from 10 PM- 7 AM; he must be in his residence between those hours unless for employment or medical purposes.

2:11 PM Called 22CF194 set for PH, and 22CF126, 22CF154 and 22CF170 for STC. Defendant Jacob T Hughes-Lepinski in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Jacob T Hughes-Lepinski.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. State confirms in VR compliance, vic is present, okay to start early.  Case 22CF194 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information, mirrors criminal complaint.  Defense has a motion regarding bond, Def and vic both have participated in class, completed bond modification class.  Court questions vic.  Bond amended to have no abusive contact with vic.  State doesn't object as long as bond is modified to no violent or abusive contact.  Court grants.  Arraignment scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:07 PM Called 22CF154 & 22CF170 for PH.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob T Hughes-Lepinski in court, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Jacob T Hughes-Lepinski.  All parties appear in person.  Set for PH's today, updated they will be WOPH. Def confirms they will both be WOPH's. 22CF154 and 22CF170 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearings:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made in each matter.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information's in both cases. Set out ARGN, for Sept 15 at 10am.  Court calls new case 22CF194 for INIT. Same appearances as noted above.  Attny Pollak will assist on this matter today, has criminal complaint in hand.  Case 22CF194 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waive time limits on PH.  State thinks current bond covers this matter.  State asks for bond to remain.  Court sees bond has been set.  PH scheduled for August 25th at 2:15pm. 22CF126 for STC will track along.  Arraignment scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:29 PM Cases 22CF126, 22CF154, and 22CF170 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob T Hughes-Lepinski in court. Attorney Pollak appears in person for defendant.  Def explains missed appearance.  Court quashes the warrants.  Atty Pollak updates- only appointed in 22CF126- not on the other files yet; is prepared to do arraignment as scheduled in 22CF126.  Case 22CF126 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Cases 22CF154 and 22CF170 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.  Def to provide prints in 22CF170 before leaving the building.  Bond continues.  Def to sign his amended bond form.
Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No contact with the victim or his residence.  No driving without a valid driver's license.  No driving any vehicles without the vehicle owners' consent.
$250 cash bond ordered to cover warrants in Burnett County cases 22CF126, 22CF154, and 22CF170.  Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.

10:44 AM Cases 22CF170, 22CF154, 22CF126 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob T Hughes-Lepinski not in court. Atty Gabriel Pollak appears in person.  Defendant fails to appear.  Atty Pollak, representing in 22CF126, notes he has not been appointed in the other files; references a letter filed requesting a bond modification; explains def's failure to appear.  State responds, requests forfeiture of any cash bond and for a warrant.  Court takes judicial notice of prior cases, will not amend bond condition at this time unless both victim and def take the CRA class.  Court orders warrant, $250 cash, only judge may quash.  Court will allow def to turn himself in.
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant
